A Google co-founder, 38-year-old Larry Page , will return to the chief executive's job he surrendered in 2001, while Eric Schmidt , 55, who has run the company since then, will become executive chairman. Adult supervision no longer needed, Eric Schmidt tweeted about the change. He will instead do what executive chairpersons do, which is show up whenever asked and try to be helpful. After that article appeared, tech blogger John Gruber gave Eric Schmidt a new title: attendees at a forum organized by the Atlantic Monthly heard him testify to how much Google could learn about its users with their permission: We don't need you to type at all. We know where you are. We know where you've been. We can more or less know what you're thinking about. * In an CNN interview later that month, Eric Schmidt joked that users offended by photos of their homes showing up in Google's Street View mapping feature could href="http://voices.washingtonpost.com/posttech/2010/10/google_street_view_app_raises.html">`` just move.'' it was Kenyon Martin 's defense that had coach George Karl talking. Allen Iverson had 36 points, Carmelo Anthony added 33 and Kenyon Martin shut down ToMetta World Peaceto all-star Chris Bosh late as Denver rallied to beat the ToMetta World Peaceto Raptors 109-100 on Sunday afternoon. Kenyon Martin 's defense on Chris Bosh was incredible and got better as the game went on, George Karl said.`` You win games with stops more than making Robert Horrys. The next step is to reduce U.S. unemployment, an issue Barack Obama should make`` the centerpiece'' of his annual State of the Union address on Jan. 25, the former Cabinet member said. The American people are expecting him to say something about what he's going to do to keep the economy moving forward, Colin Powell said. Colin Powell has criticized his own party in recent months while supporting Barack Obama 's ultimately successful fight for Senate ratification of a new nuclear-arms-reduction treaty with Russia.
